channel.title: Copy of Digg top 24 hours
channel.description: RSS feed with direct links to popular technology articles. based on superdigg pipe

item.title: [+3247] 13 Things a Burglar Won't Tell You
item.description: (4.) "Yes, I really do look for newspapers piled up on the driveway. And I might leave a pizza flyer in your front door to see how long it takes you to remove it."

item.title: [+2535] Wal-Mart, CVS, Best Buy ditch Glenn Beck (plus more!)
item.description: Big news today. Eight more major advertisers have pulled their support from Glenn Beck -- Wal-Mart, Best Buy, CVS, Travelocity, Allergan (maker of Restasis), Ally Bank, Broadview Security, and Re-Bath. And more!

item.title: [+1891] Even more advertisers leave Glenn Beck -- Including WALMART
item.description: Because of you and people like you signing petitions and picking up telephones to say 'No more', Color of Change announced Monday that Walmart, a key bank with GMAC Financial Services, Best Buy, CVS, Travelocity, Re-Bath, Broadview Security and Allergan have all backed out, bringing the list of former Glenn Beck advertisers to Twenty.

item.title: [+1880] Xbox 360 at 54.2% Failure Rate
item.description: The Xbox 360's current failure rate due to the Red Ring of Death, E74 or other hardware failure is 54.2 percent. They also calculated the relative death toll for PS3s due to the Yellow Light of Death (10.3 percent) and Wiis, due to ... well, we're not actually sure what color the Wii's light turns to upon its demise (6.8 percent).

item.title: [+1814] Sony unveils slimmer PS3: $300, lands in September
item.description: "Hardly a surprise, but Sony got on stage today at GamesCom and confirmed what we've all knew deep down in our hearts: the new, slimmer PS3 is really real."

item.title: [+1641] Diseased? Shopped? Or Awesome?
[+1615] 25 Awesome Homeless Guy Signs
item.description: Now days, being homeless is more competitive than ever. Only the most clever and creative signs are going to get people to let go of their precious spare change. This makes for some pretty awesome homeless dude signage.

item.title: [+1367] Let There Be Light!
[+1267] If websites were people [PIC]
[+1059] GMAC Financial Services "Ceases Advertising" on Glenn Beck S
item.description: Thats the word this morning from spokesperson Sue Mallino, who confirmed to Media Matters that it pulled its ads off the Fox News program. Mallino would not comment on whether the move was made in response to Beck's claim that Obama is a "racist" an allegation that sparked a campaign by ColorofChange.org to get advertisers to stop supporting Beck.

item.title: [+868] Cops Use Old Brink's Truck to Shame Suspects
item.description: Peoria, Ill. has found a new way to fight crime: Park an unmanned former Brinks truck bristling with video cameras in front of the homes of troublemakers. Police here call it the Armadillo. They say it has restored quiet to some formerly rowdy streets. Neighbors calls for help have dropped sharply. About half of the truck's targets have fled town.

item.title: [+764] The 10 Stupidest Tech Company Blunders
item.description: Some of the biggest high-tech deals never happened. Some of the most promising products and services never came to be. Why? Because the people and companies involved didn't realize what they were letting slip through their fingers, or they simply couldn't foresee what would happen afterward.

item.title: [+754] An explosive so sensitive, it will detonate with a feather
item.description: Nitroglycerin is moderately easy to detonate, and a hammer is more than enough. Nitrogen triiodide will detonate if it is merely breathed on.

item.title: [+717] Man spent 22 years in jail for a crime he did not commit.
item.description: Bernard Baran, an openly gay man, has spent half his life behind bars on child molestation charges that the state no longer has the confidence to retry. Baran says that during his jail term he was raped and beaten more than 30 times, necessitating six different transfers to new correctional institutions.

item.title: [+698] FAMILY GUY: Where's My Emmy, Man?! (Video)
item.description: Hollywood Reporter: Stewie wants his Emmy and he wants it NOW. This is hysterical.

item.title: [+687] Why I Hate The Moviegoing General Public
item.description: Yes you. The general public. What has happened to you? Why is it you've made going to the movies about as much fun as lying down face first on a colony of Bullet Ants? Where have the manners gone? Where has the common sense disappeared to?

item.title: [+668] 10 Awesome Package Designs
item.description: Have you ever bought something just because it's package? Well, these package designs are definitely one of a kind and they do make you want to get them regardless of what is inside. This list contains different kind of packages but they all have some in common; they are awesome, check it out!

item.title: [+634] Bell Internet - It knows what kind of guy you are [PIC]
item.description: Perfect for hookups with no commitment

item.title: [+632] Starcraft 2 Getting DRM Protection
item.description: It is reported that Blizzard is finally going to use DRM (Digital Rights Management) and the first game to use it will be Starcraft 2.

item.title: [+623] 10 Things You Need to Know About HDMI 1.4
item.description: A complete guide to the next HDMI standard. With one eye firmly on the digital home there are several significant improvements to the technology, including integrated data connectivity and support for 3D.
